Douglas had the longest tenure of any Justice, serving on the Supreme Court for thirty-six years, spanning the careers of five Chief Justices. He retired on November 12, 1975, and died on January 19, 1980, at the age of eighty-one.

detail.reasoning: The text claims that Justice William O. Douglas was the oldest judge in the U.S. Supreme Court in 1980. However, the evidence shows that William O. Douglas retired on November 12, 1975, and died on January 19, 1980, at the age of eighty-one. Therefore, he was not serving as a judge in 1980, and thus could not have been the oldest judge on the Supreme Court at that time.
detail.error: The text incorrectly states that William O. Douglas was the oldest judge in the U.S. Supreme Court in 1980.
detail.correction: In 1980, Justice William O. Douglas was no longer serving on the U.S. Supreme Court, as he had retired in 1975.
